page.title: 05SHOPS IN FENCE
page.content: Fence village is a very quiet and boring place.Apart from the bypass,it is well away from noise and industry. As it's name suggests, Fence was once the border to the Forest of Pendle in which the King kept his deer.The village has 3 shops,churches and pubs.Fence is surrounded on three sides by beautiful countryside with the equally pretty villages of Barley and Newchurch near by.The village has a Green Slate shop, a H.A.P.P.A. <Horse and Ponies Protection Association>,a Sports Club and a small park.When standing outside the old mill,looking down the village you can see where the old Co Op once was and where the Post Office is.Looking up the village you are able to see the Village Shop which sells sweets,alcohol and some groceries.You can also see the Methodist Chapel.
